title: Crispy Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon

description: These Crispy Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon are the perfect side dish that combines savory flavors and satisfying crunch. With just a few simple ingredients, you can create a dish that will impress your family and friends.
ingredients: 1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: In a large bowl, toss the halved Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the Brussels sprouts on a baking sheet and sprinkle the chopped bacon on top.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until the Brussels sprouts are crispy and the bacon is cooked.
tips: For extra crispiness, make sure to spread the Brussels sprouts in a single layer on the baking sheet and avoid overcrowding.

structured_content.content: These Crispy Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon are not just a side dish; they are a celebration of flavors and textures. The combination of crispy bacon and tender Brussels sprouts creates a delightful contrast that is hard to resist. Perfect for any occasion, this dish will have everyone coming back for seconds!

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made these Brussels sprouts for a family gathering. Everyone was skeptical at first, but once they took a bite, they couldn't stop raving about them. Now, they are a staple at our holiday dinners!

• Main ingredient: Fresh Brussels sprouts work best for this recipe; look for firm, green sprouts without blemishes.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Olive oil enhances the natural flavors while salt and pepper bring out the best in the ingredients.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bacon adds a savory, smoky flavor that complements the Brussels sprouts perfectly.
  • Equipment needed: A large baking sheet and a mixing bowl are essential for this recipe.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Begin by preheating your oven to 400째F (200째C). Trim and halve the Brussels sprouts, and chop the bacon into small pieces.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Toss the Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Spread them on a baking sheet and sprinkle the bacon on top. Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Finishing Touches:
Once crispy and golden, remove from the oven and serve warm. Enjoy the delightful crunch!

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Roasting at a high temperature ensures crispy Brussels sprouts.
  • A common mistake is overcrowding the baking sheet, which can lead to steaming instead of roasting.
  • Look for a golden brown color and crispy edges to know they are done.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing these Brussels sprouts with friends and family has become a cherished tradition. The joy on their faces when they taste them is priceless, and it makes cooking so much more rewarding.
For an extra kick, try adding a sprinkle of red pepper flakes or a drizzle of balsamic glaze before serving. You can also experiment with different herbs like thyme or rosemary for added flavor.

These Brussels sprouts pair wonderfully with roasted meats, such as chicken or pork, and make a great addition to any holiday table. Serve alongside a crisp salad or a hearty grain for a complete meal.
For a vegetarian version, omit the bacon and add toasted nuts for crunch. You can also try adding cranberries or feta cheese for a festive twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For restaurant-quality results, use a hot oven and ensure the Brussels sprouts are dry before roasting.
  • Chop the bacon into small pieces for even cooking and distribution.
  • Stirring halfway through roasting helps achieve uniform crispiness.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.
